candidates.title: In Pictures: Stunning sunrise around Scotland to start the week
candidates.content:
A stunning sunrise brightened the skies above Scotland on Monday morning.
Impressive photographs have been shared on social media and by BBC Weather Watchers.
The pink and orange rises were captured in places including Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, Angus, Fife, the Highlands and the Scottish Borders.
All photos are subject to copyright.
candidates.description: Impressive photographs from across Scotland have been shared on social media and by BBC Weather Watchers.

candidates.title: BBC Weather
candidates.content:
Thursday
A colder start to the new year, with rain and hill snow on the mainland clearing to leave bright spells, patchy cloud and scattered snow showers for all. Winds easing a touch, but still rather windy.
Outlook for Friday to Sunday
Thursday will stay cold, with wintry sunshine and scattered snow showers over the Isles and northern mainland coasts. Friday looks to see showers easing on the mainland with variable cloud and bright spells. Drier too for Orkney, but wintry showers continuing for Shetland. Cloudy on the Isles on Saturday with a few showers, but dry with variable cloud again on the mainland.
